definition: not to listen/to be deaf to
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: She ranted and raved for two whole days and wouldn't listen to reason.
sentences.chinese: 她大叫大嚷吵了整整两天，什么也听不进去。

sentences.english: These adults can take no comfort from their younglings.
sentences.chinese: 有些大人根本听不进去孩子们的安慰。

sentences.english: I just can't take the advice that I shouldn't be worried about stammering.
sentences.chinese: 有人建议我不要担心口吃，但我就是听不进去。

sentences.english: Dumb sister moved out of the green farming method, Jin Cai can not hear.
sentences.chinese: 哑妹搬出了“绿色养殖法”，金财听不进去。

sentences.english: He turned a deaf ear to criticism.
